Header: Sudanese renew protests to demand civilian rule
Content: At least seven demonstrators in Sudan have been killed and more than 180 injured as tens of thousands poured onto the streets across the country to pressure the country’s ruling generals to hand over power to a civilian-led administration and seek justice for the scores of victims of a deadly military crackdown. Dubbed the “millions march”, yesterday’s mass demonstrations were the first since security forces on June 3 killed more than 100 people during the bloody dispersal of a protest camp outside the military headquarters, the focal point of the protesters’ months-long struggle for democracy. There was a “huge turnout” in the capital, Khartoum, despite a widespread internet blackout.
